list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a bulletin about the Queen’s illness.
a monthly bulletin of local news.

list_ex_of_english: You find them in newspapers, magazines, radio news bulletins, even the occasional novel.
E-mail makes available bulletin boards, news groups, lists and broadcasting.
Millions of young urbanites get news bulletins text messaged to them over their cellular telephones.
Potential dangers are publicized through extensive dissemination of brochures, medical bulletins, posters, and related materials.
Inevitably every time a news bulletin is switched on the listener opens the door to something new and potentially unpleasant.
His bulletins from the front, describing the atrocious conditions there, were widely credited with prompting action at home.
But then my experiences were from solid city buildings and with up-to-date news bulletins of state measures to carry people and livestock to safety.
Even if the bulletin board metaphor does not really describe the method of distribution, it aptly characterizes the contents of network list postings.
